verbatim_example: Does anyone else have experience with this? Does anyone know what dangers there are with this (aside from obvious IV related dangers), based on facts or direct experience?
I'm in Scotland, just scored a half teenth, shot up a couple of times and am up for learning about a bit about whoever is up for a chat - what it's like having a habit where you are etc...
My question, to the socially adept of us here, is - how do you socialize with people? How do you stay socially relevant while dealing with this problem?
Can anyone relate? I don't know how to build up the energy to fight this anymore.
I'm just sharing this to see if anyone else can relate and if anyone has anything to add or share with me?

Curious if anyone can relate on trying to isolate yourself from everything to basically hide your using or thinking you were just trying to hide the days when you were planning on tapering or quitting.
I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse.
Sometimes I think a work routine, being around co-workers, etc will be good to establish before jumping off all the way. Basically use Kratom like suboxone.
I wanna beat his ass, I wanna make sure he's okay, I wanna be there for him while he has no one at this shelter 100's of miles from home.
How can I get the best bang for my buck with them? I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high. Is there's a better way for me to dose these?
Am I the only one? Is it because I haven't done H?
haven't had any opis in months
I am a little worried that the worst is yet to come. Other than restless legs, I have almost fine. Is the worst still coming or what?
I feel great all day, but I can't handle the wrestless legs at night. Tips please?
I am scared bc I know I am going to be in pain. I am scared bc I know I will want to use.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia...
I don't even remember how it's done. I am happy to be here, sober .
I've never been friends with another addict, but I am so damn lonely.
Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Can't tell you how much more I love myself and life. If I can do it, any of you guys can.
Anyone down for a recovery fantasy league? I used to run one in r/opiates but figured I could get some people who actually could participate in the entire season through this sub.
If I can do it any of you can. Do what works for you.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...What a difference a year can make.
I’m officially one year clean from opiates. Probably the biggest accomplishment of my life to say the least.
Wish me luck everyone... this community is amazing.
Despite what stage you're in, just know that whatever time you have cleared, you never have to do that part again.
I'm thankful that my OCD doesn't stop, even in W/D.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. Not as cool as r/The_Motel 's 112 but better than nothing.

I wish I could be saying all of this with a clearer head and more time under my belt... Nevertheless I haven't worked this hard for something in the last 2 years except finding pills. Now the work comes with a reward instead of a temporary numbing of everything around me.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.

I was talking to someone last night about how most of us do enough research to have PhDs in this shit. Sometimes I wish I had a simple tracked mind that didn't try to identify all the bullshit that takes place.
I immediately got up with one of my biggest supporters, played the tape of days 1-7, took some deep breaths (maybe smoked a bit of weed) and went on a jog with my dog.
Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go. Energy/happiness comes in more spurts with less feelings of gloom and doom.
Hoping today goes by quick so at least I don't have to deal with work for 2 days. Hoping I can get some solid sleep and "relax" time this weekend. Almost 3 weeks!
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
I started to think I was coming out of the fog for a bit. ... Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I've now gone five days without, and I can't help but think, fuck it, one more time, whats the big deal? Ill be gone soon anyway with no connects so what can happen??
I haven't been using for almost two months.
Hang in there. I'm already doing much better.
Every. Minute. Every. Hour. Each one is one closer to being better.
I think I can do this. I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
Im still only a few days clean, but im not turning back.
You guys have helped so much. I love you all. You can do it. I know it.
All you guys and gals.... Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can.

I feel my addiction is controlled and I'm able to live a normal and productive life. Am I eventually doomed to start taking harder more dangerous opiates? :/ None of the text asks if others can relate to the experience of recovery.
Just because we're addicts doesn't mean we need to go through withdrawals.

But, this time I fucked up. As I finish off a bag of poppyseeds, I go to check my emergency supply and find out I only have FIVE POUNDS LEFT! Which is maybe 5 days worth of tea if I really stretch it and taper down.
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!

This sub had helped me with countless issues, and given me superb advice over the last 4 years, so I just wanted to see if anyone could offer me some advice, or possibly provide insight if you've experienced something similar.
I swear, that game is my first real experience with addiction.
Perhaps one of you will have something amazing to say.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. I had planned to document daily, but I've left that idea behind.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.

I wanted to thank all of you who responded to my previous post and encourage anyone who may read this another day. We can do it, and it's not shameful to be afraid and work through that fear with others.
But, guys... if I had them, they would be 100% gone. Which makes me feel like shit.

One of the people I have met along the way during my most recent and most successful stretch of clean time asked me this simple question:
"How long were you using for?"
Upon my answer of eight years, he replied: "You have to be realistic with yourself. Do you think you can be back where you want to be in one month after eight years of using? Exactly."
I encourage anyone who wants to make that change to realize that you already do know, in your heart, that you are fully capable of changing.
Thank you for listening to my rant. I would love to hear from anyone going through this very difficult journey.

If you happen to be unlucky enough to have gotten the flu- would that not be a potentially perfect situation to just jump off? Since you are already experiencing all of the terrible physical symptoms whether you like it or not, I wonder if this situation would make it “easier” both physically and mentally, since you know you are going to feel that way regardless of using or not.
I just want to write this so that those who are in the state and/or timeframe that I was in at this point two years ago to know that it gets so, so much better.
Clean for over two years... Why am I still searching this shit.
Unfortunately, being legitimately clean and sober for two years only works if you cut off everyone from your past. What would you do if you were in my shoes?
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
Looking too damn healthy after two years clean.

So does anyone else, besides me, feel like our experience has been a huge teacher in life and something that you are actually thankful that you went through? I feel almost blessed that I am able to live my life this way. I know it sounds crazy.
Please everyone, get clean and stay clean. Life is so much more than an early death to an OD and being an addict with nothing to live for.
Does anyone else have this? It gets me really uncomfortable sometimes.
Big fan of the tan, hate white dope

Call me a junkie while I slap my monkey . - This post title contains language that implies opiate use ('junkie') and references the physical symptoms of withdrawal ('slap my monkey'), which is slang for 'kicking the habit' or experiencing withdrawal.
So I'm just wondering does heroin feel better the second time?
anyways I'm just curious how did your first opiate high go and how are you doing now?
Please. If you're thinking of trying heroin please please please do not do it. It's not fun anymore. Please don't do it. Please listen to the good people here who tell you not to fuck with it.
Am I wrong for feeling this way, or what? Thanks for reading.
does anyone have like, tips on managing opiate use? And if I were to ever do it again, I'd like to know what other people do.
So if you’re getting sober, don’t give up. Just wanted to put it out there!
I am struggling atm. Depression is a big struggle and i just want to numb everything out.
I no i need to pick myself up as soon as i can.
Im sick of feeling like crap, throwing up, being depressed and i wish it would hurry up and go away.
Yes i no i go on about being depressed alot and i feel alot of u may or may not be getting sick of me telling u about it.
I want to celebrate but am unsure of how to. I am proud of myself for making it this far.
I often feel like everyone would be better without me.
When i try to eat or drink liquids all i do is puke them back up. Im pretty sure im dehydrated but cant seem to hold anything down any advice?
They say they'll may discharge me after the weekend.
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin. That is good as i plan to keep the days going up :)
I am trying my best to sort everything out. Im trying to fit in with the normal ppl who dont do drugs and stuff.

Has anyone else had this feeling early in the process, before talking to doctors, counselors, etc.? All of the literature is, for the most part is, super sober people saying the only way to do this is 100% straight, OR people thinking they thought could do it their way and being wrong. Anyone else?
To anyone that is hesitant to go, or thinks their recovery program doesn't need NA, I urge you to give it a shot. And don't just go one day, give it an honest chance.

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could sill drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.
Just curious to know how many meetings do you go to per week (if any), and how much clean time do you have?
Must warn others- I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.

I've been talking to this REALLY REALLY hot 18 year old girl at meetings lately and I'm pretty sure she's feeling me... but MY FUCKING RECOVERY. Ugh, I hate this moral and rational compass I'm developing.
Life keeps on getting better. My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
How about y'all? No wrong answers, I'm just curious whether you go to meetings or not.

What made me want to change for the better was being in the ER after almost over dosing on heroin and acting very belligerent towards my mom. To this day I still have no idea what I said or did that caused her to call the cops.
I still feel like I'm missing something. I guess I am still addicted to chaos.
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!
To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs.
If there's those on this sub who are still using, There's government programs available as well as rehabs such as BFC who do financial assistance.
Sorry you guys don't have the same luck, or if you do share your good experiences. Hell share the bad ones too lol
Anyone else have a d boy that hooks it up on birthday's?
Anyone else find a connect from uber or something random like that?
I'm baaaack! Not that anyone noticed I was even gone lmao. Plus a little dope tease

So of course we look to see if it contains any goodies (we always look lmao) and there in the bag, was fucking 3 grams of crack!!!! We snatched that shit up so quick and went straight to the dope boys spot.

Also I know many other addicts some of whom have progressed very deep into addiction and every time those ones try to get clean it never lasts. For example, my one friend has been shooting heroin & coke for over 7 years. He has been to 9 rehabs always relapsing within 3 months after his release.

I know what I'm doing is trying to replace one addiction with another, which isn't necessarily healthy. However this is where I'm at in my process so the best I can do is share about it, seek advice and take the right actions to move forward.
if anyone has suggestions on how to keep busy and start enjoying everyday activities again I'd love to hear them!
For all of you who've decided to as of tomorrow, good for you and feel free to PM me if you need something or just want to talk to someone.
To all of you who've offered your support and kind words thus far, thank you for all of the help and for giving me the strength to have made it this far.

So my main question is, does anyone have suggestions on dealing with the boredom, and other tips for getting and staying clean? I've gone through WDs before, but I always crack as soon as I have access to opiates again. I really want to STAY clean this time, and I'm hoping some of you guys will have advice on how to do so.
So, what have you guys found to provide a good rush (besides dope)? I need some euphoria in my life and can't find it...
Does my previous use mean that I’m more prone to WDs after just a few doses.
What does everyone here think? It would absolutely crush my family if they knew I relapsed, and it doesn't seem like enough of a setback to count it as one, but I don't know. Any advice?
What does everyone here think? It would absolutely crush my family if they knew I relapsed, and it doesn't seem like enough of a setback to count it as one, but I don't know. Any advice?
If anyone wants to talk please feel free to PM me.

I feel that going through the withdrawals combined with not having any crutches will give me some enlightenment and allow me to completely focusing on recovery instead of worrying about my next nic fix.
I used yesterday for the first time in 119 days, and again this morning.
I just want to know how some of you get through that.
I had a good day yesterday reconnecting with some friends who I lost to my addiction
I feel his story is close to a lot of ours.

I'd like to thank some of you guys in here for being awesome and talking to me when I've been having a rough time and just keeping me on track. So if anyone needs some advice or just simply to talk to whether it's about getting clean or just how your day's going send me a message.
Slowly saving back up to rebuild it now that I'm sober.
I've been running and addiction and support group for almost a year now. I use kratom to treat members of the group with better success than I've seen in most other programs.
After a 3 month dry spell I got to pick up.
Just making this post to see if anyone relates.
To all reading this looking for help or inspiration you CAN do it, trust me if I can, anyone can.
Does anyone have any advice on something that can help me sleep without aggravating the RLS?
Does anyone think this is related to the opiate quitting again?
Thanks all it you read this, this sub has been really key in me cleaning up, so thanks again to all you lovely people.
I guess I forgot what getting sick is like?  Also my chronic heartburn is back with a vengeance after stopping.
If I take it and it doesn't work well and I stop, will I have w/d symptoms? Any advice or knowledge would be great.
Throwing this out there for advice, encouragement, and the sense of community I craved and needed when first getting clean.

I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years. Made it through a pretty rough trigger, proud of myself .
So I come here looking for support again, just as I did about a year ago today when I got clean.
holy crap, does anyone else have a backache from hell?
I got dizzy and nauseous and angry, I felt attacked (which is nuts).
Hold on guys, we can kick this shit!
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much.
I'm so weak, it's been years. But I'm walking a bit, I take the stairs, I stretch.

I was hungry today for the first time in ages, really hungry. I ate through half a box of crackers and two apples, some cheese, and I can't stop drinking water. It's like my body WANTS to get better now.
I'm doing it, guys, one day at a time. Oh, and, by the by... the family is planning a big trip for this summer. Our first EVER vacation together. And I plan to be one super-sober traveller,
I didn't even think to bring a damn Advil in my bag.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
I guess some sort of happy 'yay I'm off the shit' happy time is over.
By the time the conversation was over I wanted to be drunk or high, god I was frustrated.
I think about using and reason it out. It makes no sense to go back.

I think about using sometimes, I do recognize that I am not immune to that pull... Life gets hard and I want to check out, but I don't. I remember how shit it was most of the time, how sick I got, how needy I became.
I genuinely lost track. Life got busy, and I'm okay, and I've thought about it, and been tempted, but I'm still here.
I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live.
I really hope we all, myself included... can figure this whole thing out.
I'm in my second year of sobriety and I can attest to the fact that it's not just about quitting, but about rebuilding your life. Can anyone else relate?
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.
Don't feel like you've made things too bad or that you'll never reach a certain level of happiness again... hard work and honesty will take you places you won't believe.
If Friday nights were hard for me and I would think about getting high I told people in my life I couldn't be alone on Friday nights.

Have any of you been through this? How do you cope with the emotions of not being accepted as a normal human being even though you are doing all that you can do and genially care about others and show it day in and day out.
Is this Flakka? What is going on? Am I losing my mind?
Who else is low on fund and that is the reason they are clean?
Have 5 more mgs of oxy for a little later.
I want to want to get clean but it's hard to see it.
I haven't been able to come just due to the temptations but I wanted to let people know it is possible.
I really really want to use again.
Does anyone have any experience with this or thoughts? Should something like this stick around so long after use?
I'd be interested in smoking instead of shooting but I find it gets me so nauseous that I don't even feel high. Anyone else have this experience or some advice?
I don't plan on ever going back to daily use mostly because it's a waste of money/time and I feel like it loses it's magic.
She feels like she can't live without it at least once or twice a week, which I told her was fine as long as she doesn't go overboard.
I hope all of you going through hard times have your day soon! Keep your heads up when you’re not on the nod ;)

Pretty insecure about it cause I only really make joke music. Being serious scares the christ outta me... Anyways lmk what you think, any constructive criticism is accepted with open arms. Pretty new to this music thing.
it's about my mindset when I was using
Will this set me back in my recovery.
Can anyone elaborate on that anger? Have you ever felt it?

when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. Because you are gonna need you space your chance to avoid that temptation and find the bigger person in you.

I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me. Now I have messed with drugs my entire adult life, more recreationally. That was until a few years ago and one injury led me down a path that didn't take any time at all to get to the end of.
Some advice could be useful. Thanks everyone, this thread really does help through the day.
Stay clean everybody and thank y'all for the support I have gotten here.

Didn't get to spend much time with her, but the joy I saw on her face when I wished her a happy birthday before anything else and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober was great motivation for the day.
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life. And this goes out to anyone out there who knows they need to bite the bullet.
Obviously the mental aspect will take time, but anyone who's interested or has questions feel free to shoot me a pm.

To anyone out there who is on day 1 week 1 week 2 etc. I know how INSURMOUNTABLE it seems. But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like. It WILL fall into place.
Long story short, it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
Very interesting and is helping me through my addiction.
You all can do this. Stay strong. It's worth it folks.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals...
I will go to outpatient and meetings as much as I can.

Well today I sat in my room, usually takes me 10 to 15 minutes to completely focus my thoughts on my breathing as I do mainly concentration breathing. Well a breakdown goes of the first 10 minutes, focusing and centering myself.
I don't know why but whenever I get yelled at or she is in tears, I can't help but smile. I know I don't want too and I geniuely feel horrible for what I've done in the past.
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.
Sober roughly four months now. First time listening to this song since the deepest parts of my drug induced depression.
This got me happy about my future and I could see how listening to this may help those earlier in recovery.
......damn, was a dark individual during those times. hahaha, I can't even believe I wrote that considering the change within my self over this past year.
If anybody needs any help at all or just wants to talk about their struggles, I am more than happy to give you some hope.
Wish me luck guys, I’m am scared
What should I expect? Should I prepare for something? What did you wish you knew before you went ahead and did something like this?
Bonus question: What are some stories from when you where treated? Would love to hear about other peoples experience.
Would like to support someone dealing with heroin addiction
However I feel like my personality is back, I have dreams (goals), and feel pleasure from doing stuff again like listening to music and shit, which is awesome
But I want to listen to others that tried and fucked up, how and why did it happen, also if someone managed to stick to it, how do you stay strong and did you exp some negative consequences?
How is that even possible? Can I never become a chipper?

Also real quick, I read that paws last like a long time, can someone fill me inn on what it really is and how long it takes or whatever? Been on iv heroin for four years. Wanna try sober living like as an experience or something,
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
Plan on taking 16mgs. I am an IV user and was probably shooting up half a gram to gram of heroin a day or 3 to 8 diluadeds a day.
Just hoping someone out there has some profound knowledge I never heards...
I'm driving from NY to FL and want to get high while driving but thinking it can be dangerous. Maybe only get a touch high? What do you all think?
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon. ... So I am basically going to go through it this time and need some support from you guys again to get through it.
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon. ... So I am basically going to go through it this time and need some support from you guys again to get through it.
How long does it take to officially get your sleep back, another week? When did you guys get your energy back?
Thanks guys, other than that I'm still grinding along and feeling a little better each day.
Has anyone else got clean and started feeling this way? It has me pretty down in the dumps.
Is it time to start making changes to become happy even if I am the only one that approves?
Today is day 1 after coming off a two week run. Any idea on what to expect for withdrawal from only a 2 week run? Will it be just as bad when I came off my 5 month run?
Some Wednesday motivation for you people struggling like me or feel like quitting .

I’m currently 12 hours clean and all I am really asking is that if there is anybody nice enough that would be willing to text with me while I go through withdrawal, especially during them hard days at work so I don’t feel so alone.
Any experience with this out there?

I did manage to get 8 hours last night because I took 60mg of melatonin (which I’m sure is not healthy) but woke up feeling like I slammed a handle of jack daniels the previous night. And I can only do that on nights I don’t have work the next day.
For people who quit how long did it take for sleep to return?
Any opinions or someone with experience?
Has anybody here done it before and how did you do it? Any tips will help.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
Can anybody relate? Obviously the PAWS just makes it worse buts it’s been a problem my whole life that I have not been able to conquer and has really held me back in life.
Anyone on here right now that is sober or looking to get sober willing to talk?
If I ever got pulled over and they ran a dog around my car how could I make sure the K9 would not hint on my car just in case I did miss something.
I'm contemplated going cold turkey because I don't want to go there everyday and become a zombie, what can I experience after 2 days?
Have you been to NA meetings? I'm thinking about going, one step closer to fighting the addiction that ruined my life and relationships financially and overcome the needle.
despite losing it all I am glad I can say we don't have to worry about where money will come and trying to get through each day without having to WD
I've only used shit ppl gave me so I'm not familiar with the terminology for getting them.
My main question here for my people in recovery is what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself?

Now that I'm sober I can never understand how people can function every day with a opiate addiction. Like being dope sick and needing to be high having lil to no money? I just wanna hear y'all stories on how you do it!

When I was using my H I've used every ROA except for the hole booty juicing. Anyways whenever I used H I can count on 1 foot how many times I've thrown up, but now that I snort PK I always seem to throw up even off of 20 mg!!!

When I'm high off H, I become a very social person. I can talk to random people about anything. I consider my self a very introvert when I'm not using. Overall when I'm high I'm just a nice friendly guy! What about you guys/gals?
I'd really like some advice from anyone that's been in a similar situation.
Finally ready to make recovery my priority.
I went last night to my first NA meeting in years and it was awesome! Met some great people and ran into an old friend. I really liked the format, and it was at midnight which was really helpful.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I know weekends are the most difficult time for me, what about you?
We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.
How are you doing today? If you haven't been told, you are loved! No matter if you're 1 day, 1 week, 1 month, 1 year, or more; just stay sober for today.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. ... This will be the first trip I have every taken sober...
I never thought I could recover. I had lost all hope and accepted that my addiction would eventually kill me, and I didn't care.
How are you doing today? Weather you have years, months, days, or hours clean or even if you just have the desire to stop using post up and tell us.
Anyway, it gets a lot easier. Life's so much fucking better now even on my worst days. Hang in there if you're stuggling.
I'm grateful for everyday I wake up feeling like a normal person. I'm grateful that this 23 time has seemed to be the charm.

If your on day 1 or just struggling just know that it gets so much better if you just stick it out and put in some effort. Also, know the only difference between an addict with 10 minutes, 10 days, 10 months, or 10 years of clean time is one bad choice.
Anyone else have this?  ...I've had weird crap where shadow people come talk to me crouched by my bed which meth people know about but I was only on h, I can forgive it as hallucinations.
I haven't done opiates in 10 months and I still fantasize about doing dope constantly.  And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.
does anyone else deal with this at such a young age? I am 21, but I don't feel mentally equipped to deal with this elephant in the room.
How do you guys deal with being patient? I realize that taking the sub last night will likely leave me with only minor WDs today, but tomorrow will be the worst if my package doesn't arrive.

Holy shit, it's the morning of day 3 and I'm still clean. I havent been this far in...ever. The chills are less intense, the stomach issues are subsiding, and I actually slept like 6 hours last night (soma and drinking and smoking helped that one), so I actually don't feel bad. Is it normal to be very emotional during this time.
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I'm on day 14 now. Every day is a little but better but also a little bit harder. I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
I know it's a bad fucking idea and I've made it this far. I know I don't need to use.

I'm wondering if any of you advocate for this? I have no stance on complete abstinence one way or another. Some need to, some don't. I don't drink at all. I do smoke weed.
